DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the duration of a neuropsychological symptom.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A branch of psychology which investigates the correlation between experience or behavior and the basic neurophysiological processes. The term neuropsychology stresses the dominant role of the nervous system. It is a more narrowly defined field than physiological psychology or psychophysiology._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A branch of psychology which investigates the correlation between experience or behavior and the basic neurophysiological processes. The term neuropsychology stresses the dominant role of the nervous system. It is a more narrowly defined field than physiological psychology or psychophysiology.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: The study of how the physiology of the brain and central nervous system are related to behavior.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::48: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
